alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 7:58AM EDT until May 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the French Broad River Near Fletcher... ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TOMORROW... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River Near Fletcher. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Around 10.0 feet, the river has exceeded bankfull at the gauge site. Isolated farmland flooding is occurring in the French Broad River Valley from Etowah downstream to Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to hover around 10.5 feet all day. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
